means: 会招致不满的，激起怨恨的

sentence.Network_cn: 警官担心会进行不公正的比较。

sentence.Network_en: It is invidious to make a selection.
It would be invidious to single out any one person to thank.
sentence.Network_cn: 单独感谢任何一个人都易引起反感。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 接近inveterate的字词 ...invidious 惹人不快的,不公平的,诽谤的invidiously 不公平地
接近inveterate的字词 ...invidious 惹人不快的,不公平的,诽谤的invidiously 不公平地
1. invigilateinvidious adj．惹人反感的，招人嫉妒的v．．
explicit adj. 明确的invidious adj. 易招怨恨的malign v. 说毁；诽谤

list.abs: discriminatory attitudes and practices ; invidious comparisons ., 歧视的态度和行为 ; 不公平的比较.
invidious accusations ., 招致不满的指控.
Glossary civil rights law 民权法 invidious discrimination 嫉恨式歧视 Magistrate治安法官;司法官 summary judgment motion即决审判动议 cause of action诉因 Do you.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin invidiosus, from invidia (see envy)

entry.tran: (任务、工作)招致不满的，引起反感的
entry.def: If you describe a task or job as invidious, you mean that it is unpleasant because it is likely to make you unpopular.

example.ex: The local authority could find itself in the invidious position of having to refuse.
example.tran: 当局可能会发现自己处于必须要拒绝但又会因此而不得人心的境地。

entry.tran: (比较、选择)不公平的，难以决定的
entry.def: An invidious comparison or choice between two things is an unfair one because the two things are very different or are equally good or bad.

example.tran: 警官担心会进行不公正的比较。

example.ex: It is invidious to make a selection.

means.word_mean: 1. containing or implying a slight or showing prejudice;

auth_sentence.content: If this kind of sharing is perceived as invidious.
auth_sentence.res_content: If this kind of sharing is perceived as invidious.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If this kind of sharing is perceived as invidious.

auth_sentence.content: It would have been invidious to avoid retribution altogether.
auth_sentence.res_content: It would have been invidious to avoid retribution altogether.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It would have been invidious to avoid retribution altogether.

auth_sentence.content: Newspapers are in the same invidious position.
auth_sentence.res_content: Newspapers are in the same invidious position.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Newspapers are in the same invidious position.

stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+divide[v.分开]+ual……的→不能分开的→个人的,单独的
e出+vid看,查+ent……的→看出来了→明显的
im不+provident[adj.顾及未来的,有远见的]→adj.不顾将来的,不节俭的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 惹人反感的,招人嫉妒的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+vid看,查+ious……的→看上去不好的→有害的
pro向前+vid看+ent……的→向前看的→有远见的
provide预备,提供+ed→在……前提之下→倘若

stems_affixes.value_cn: 红利,股息;回报,效益;被除数,划分
stems_affixes.word_buile: divide[v.分开]+end→划分,区分[红利,股息也是划分出去的]
in不+divide[v.分开]+ual……的→不能分开的→个人的,单独的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 明显;显著;根据;证据;迹象
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+vid看,查+ence表名词→看出来了→明显
pro向前+vid看+ency表名词→向前看→有远见

stems_affixes.value_cn: 电视, 录象, 视频
stems_affixes.word_buile: vid看,查+eo→n.电视, 录象, 视频

stems_affixes.value_cn: 供应,供给,准备,预防,规定
stems_affixes.word_buile: pro前,提前+vid看,查+e→提前看好→预备,提供

means.word_mean: 会招致不满的,激起怨恨的

sentences.en: making invidious distinctions between the ‘deserving’ and the ‘undeserving’ poor
sentences.cn: 在“值得救济”的穷人和“不值得救济”的穷人之间制造令人厌恶的区分
